intro: Cassine kotoensis, commonly known as the Koto hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Cassine kotoensis is often found in swampy areas and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
